level.heading: RESIDENTIAL SOURCE SEPARATION OF PAPER, PAPERBOARD, AND CARDBOARD (§ 21-2001)

level.text: 2001.1 All owners and occupants of buildings authorized to receive District collection services in accordance with § 2010 shall separate paper, paperboard, and cardboard from household trash prior to setting it out for collection.
A separate collection of paper, paperboard, and cardboard shall occur in accordance with a schedule determined by the Department of Public Works (“DPW”).
2001.3 Paper, paperboard, and cardboard shall be placed at the DPW designated point of collection for recyclables.
2001.4 Paper, paperboard, and cardboard shall be set out no later than 7:00 a.m. on the scheduled day of collection and no earlier than 6:30 p.m. on the day before the scheduled collection.
